pageContext.claim: “We have defeated ISIS in Syria, my only reason for being there during the Trump Presidency.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's declaration of victory is premature. There are at least 2,000 -- and possibly as many as 8,000 -- militants holed up along the Euphrates River in eastern Syria. They have they have resisted weeks of attacks by the U.S.-supported forces. Before Trump's announcement that he was pulling U.S. troops out of Syria, senior U.S. officials had insisted U.S. forces would remain for some time because their work was not done. The British defense minister, Tobias Ellwood, responded: “I strongly disagree. It has morphed into other forms of extremism and the threat is very much alive.”
